expired.title: Your results have expired
expired.message: For your privacy, screening results are not kept for long. Let's start a new screening to find the benefits your family may qualify for.

overview.title: Your Benefit Recommendations
overview.subtitle: Based on what you shared about your family, here are the programs that may help.
overview.encouragement: Navigating these programs is hard — you are not the only family working through this. You do not have to figure everything out today, and you do not have to do it alone. Start with what feels most important to your family right now.

programs.unlikelyTitle: Other Programs (based on your answers, these may not apply)
programs.unlikelyNote: Your situation may change, or you might have additional needs that qualify you for these programs. Click a program to learn more.

documents.title: Documents You'll Need
documents.subtitle: Gather these documents to speed up your applications.

ai.fallback: We were not able to personalize this explanation right now. The expert information above has everything you need.
ai.disclaimer: This explanation is adapted to your family's situation. The expert information above is the official source.

pdf.downloadLabel: Download Your Action Plan as PDF
pdf.error: Unable to generate PDF. Please try again.

account.title: Save your progress
account.description: Create a free account to save your screening results, get reminders before benefits need renewal, and come back anytime to check your progress.
account.savedAutomatically: Your screening results will be saved automatically.

coverage.title: Federal Programs Only for {stateName}
coverage.description: We currently show federal programs (SSI, SSDI, SNAP) for {stateName}. State-specific programs like Medicaid waivers are not yet available. Sign up below to be notified when we add full {stateName} coverage.

resources.helpfulBecause: Based on your family's situation, {orgName} may be especially helpful because they offer {services}.
resources.noPartners: We're building our partner network. Check back soon for organizations in your area.
resources.noPortals: No direct application portals available for your eligible programs. Contact the organizations listed above for assistance.

actions.disclaimer: This screening is for informational purposes only. Final eligibility is determined by the program administrators.

actionPlanSteps.medicaid: Apply for Medicaid first. Many other programs require Medicaid, and it unlocks waiver services.
actionPlanSteps.ssi: Apply for SSI (Supplemental Security Income). In Kentucky, SSI often comes with automatic Medicaid.
actionPlanSteps.ssiSsdiCombined: Apply for both SSI and SSDI through Social Security. They are different programs and you may qualify for both.
actionPlanSteps.ssdi: Apply for SSDI (Social Security Disability Insurance). After 24 months, you will automatically get Medicare.
actionPlanSteps.waivers: Get on the waiver waitlist(s). These programs often have long waits, so apply as early as possible. You can be on multiple lists.
actionPlanSteps.snap: Apply for SNAP (food assistance) at kynect.ky.gov or by calling 1-855-459-6328.
actionPlanSteps.snapWithMedicaid: Apply for SNAP (food assistance). You can apply for SNAP and Medicaid together at kynect.ky.gov.

insuranceMedicaid.description: Your private insurance and Medicaid can work together.
insuranceMedicaid.recommendation: Keep your private insurance. Medicaid will work alongside it to reduce your out-of-pocket costs. Tell both your insurance company and Medicaid that you have dual coverage.

medicaidSsi.description: Getting SSI in Kentucky usually means you automatically qualify for Medicaid.
medicaidSsi.recommendation: Apply for SSI first — Medicaid may follow automatically without a separate application.

medicaidSsdi.description: After receiving SSDI for 24 months, you automatically qualify for Medicare. If you also qualify for Medicaid, you can have both.
medicaidSsdi.recommendation: Apply for both Medicaid and SSDI. After 2 years on SSDI, Medicare will be added automatically.

medicaidMichelleP.description: You need Medicaid to use the Michelle P Waiver. The waiver adds extra services on top of what Medicaid covers.
medicaidMichelleP.recommendation: Apply for Medicaid first, then apply for the Michelle P Waiver. Get on the waitlist as early as possible.

medicaidHcb.description: You need Medicaid to use the HCB Waiver. The waiver provides services in your home and community.
medicaidHcb.recommendation: Apply for Medicaid first, then get on the HCB Waiver waitlist. The wait can be long, so apply early.

medicaidScl.description: You need Medicaid to use the SCL Waiver. SCL provides comprehensive community living supports.
medicaidScl.recommendation: Apply for Medicaid first, then get on the SCL Waiver waitlist. You can be on multiple waiver waitlists.

ssiSsdi.description: SSI and SSDI are different programs. You may qualify for one or both depending on work history and income.
ssiSsdi.recommendation: Apply for both programs. They serve different purposes and can stack.

medicaidSnap.description: You can apply for both Medicaid and SNAP at the same time through kynect.
medicaidSnap.recommendation: One application at kynect.ky.gov can start both programs. This saves time.

ssiSnap.description: SSI income counts toward SNAP eligibility. You may still qualify for SNAP.
ssiSnap.recommendation: Apply for SNAP even if you receive SSI. Your SSI income will be counted, but you may still qualify.

whatIf.title: What If My Income Changes?
whatIf.subtitle: Use the slider to explore how changes in your household income might affect which programs you qualify for.
whatIf.noChange: At this income level, your program eligibility would likely stay the same.
whatIf.moveSlider: Move the slider to see how income changes could affect your eligibility.
whatIf.disclaimer: This is an estimate only. Actual eligibility depends on many factors beyond income. Contact each program for specific details.
